Well, you can always write the file in your test method or setUp method.
Many times, it's better to refactor your code so that the method under test
takes an InputStream, or something, that can be provided directly by the
test method.  I use the "difficult to test" realization to trigger writing
more general, more flexible code.  It's a good reason for writing the test
first.
 
 - George

-----Original Message-----
From: Singh Manpreet [mailto:speak2manpreet@...]

To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] writing testcase for data read from a file



This is a sort of newbie question, could anyone please
explain me how i can write a testcase for a method
which is reading data from a file.

Regards,
Manpreet
